definitions.text: primarily temporal sense; indicating or being or seeming to be limited in duration
(primarily spatial sense) having little length or lacking in length
examples: the board was a foot short

definitions.text: not sufficient to meet a need
(of memory) deficient in retentiveness or range
not holding securities or commodities that one sells in expectation of a fall in prices
of speech sounds or syllables of relatively short duration
examples: the English vowel sounds in `pat', `pet', `pit', `pot', putt' are short

definitions.text: less than the correct or legal or full amount often deliberately so

examples: a short view of the problem

definitions.text: tending to crumble or break into flakes due to a large amount of shortening
examples: shortbread is a short crumbly cookie

definitions.text: marked by rude or peremptory shortness
examples: try to cultivate a less brusque manner
the salesgirl was very short with him
